meanings.definition: A tendency to consider material possessions and physical comfort as more important than spiritual values.
meanings.sent1: Her materialism led her to prioritize buying new clothes over spending time with loved ones.
meanings.sent2: His materialism was evident in his constant pursuit of the latest gadgets and luxury items.
meanings.sent3: Despite his materialism, he found true happiness in simple moments with his family.
meanings.sent4: The weight of her materialism burdened her soul, leaving her feeling empty and unfulfilled.
meanings.sent5: Materialism can blind us to the beauty of the world beyond what money can buy.

meanings.definition: The belief that only physical matter exists and that everything can be explained in terms of physical laws.
meanings.sent1: His materialism made him skeptical of anything that couldn't be proven through scientific experiments.
meanings.sent2: The professor's materialism influenced his view that the universe operates solely based on physical principles.
meanings.sent3: In a humorous twist, his materialism led him to believe that even emotions could be measured in grams.
meanings.sent4: The materialism of the universe was like a grand puzzle waiting to be solved by human intellect.
meanings.sent5: Materialism in its purest form sees the world as a giant machine with no room for magic or mystery.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that nothing exists except matter and its movements and modifications.
meanings.sent1: Their materialism rejected the idea of a spiritual realm beyond the physical world.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher's materialism posited that consciousness itself was merely a byproduct of brain activity.
meanings.sent3: In a lighthearted moment, their materialism led them to joke that even thoughts were made of atoms.
meanings.sent4: The materialism of their worldview painted reality as a constantly shifting tapestry of particles and energy.
meanings.sent5: Materialism stripped away the illusions of the mind, revealing the stark truth of existence.
